block.p: Anna Ruth Diaz, a daughter of Madeleine and Domingo Diaz of Los Altos, Calif., was married yesterday to Scott Michael Triola, a son of Virginia and Mario F. Triola of La Grange, N.Y. The Rev. George S. Salzmann performed the ceremony at St. Cecilia's Roman Catholic Church in Boston, with the Rev. Jesus A. Diaz, the great-uncle of the bride and a Roman Catholic priest, taking part.

Mrs. Triola, 26, graduated magna cum laude from Wellesley College and, on Thursday, received an M.B.A. from Harvard University. In October she is to become a senior consultant in Boston at Deloitte Consulting. Her father is a consultant in Los Altos, providing business information to overseas companies.

George S. Salzmann performed the ceremony at St. Cecilia's Roman Catholic Church in Boston, with the Rev. Jesus A. Diaz, the great-uncle of the bride and a Roman Catholic priest, taking part.

Mrs. Triola, 26, graduated magna cum laude from Wellesley College and, on Thursday, received an M.B.A. from Harvard University. In October she is to become a senior consultant in Boston at Deloitte Consulting. Her father is a consultant in Los Altos, providing business information to overseas companies.

Mr. Triola, 27, graduated magna cum laude from Brown University and received an M.B.A. last month from the University of Pennsylvania. In October he is to become a consultant at the Boston Consulting Group. His mother retired as a mathematics teacher at the Vassar Road School in Poughkeepsie, N.Y. His father retired as a professor of mathematics at Dutchess Community College in Poughkeepsie; he is the author of ''Elementary Statistics'' (Addison Wesley Longman, 1980).
